properties.Name: Renaissance Center
properties.Notes: Headquarters to General Motors. Cars and concrete.

properties.Name: The Guardian Building
properties.Notes: Art deco skyscraper with beautiful interior mosaic work.

properties.Name: Supino Pizzeria
properties.Notes: Great pizza adjacent to Eastern Market. Voted best pizza in Michigan.

properties.Name: Fox Theatre
properties.Notes: Beautiful old restored movie palace

properties.Name: Masonic Temple
properties.Notes: Gorgeous neo-gothic building and the world's largest masonic temple.

properties.Name: Detroit Institute of Arts
properties.Notes: World class art museum. Particularly famous for the Diego Rivera's Detroit Industry Murals.

properties.Name: Slows BBQ
properties.Notes: Good barbecue in Corktown. Tends to be crowded on weekends. Located in Detroit's oldest neighborhood Corktown.

properties.Name: Michigan Central Station
properties.Notes: Detroit's most famous ruin. The last trains left the station in 1988.

properties.Name: Cafe D'Mongo's Speakeasy
properties.Notes: Speakeasy style bar with a cool vibe. Only open Fridays and Saturdays.

properties.Name: Lafayette Coney Island
properties.Notes: Retro coney island restaurant. Best in the city. Try neighbor and rival American Coney Island and decide which is best.

properties.Name: McGregor Conference Center
properties.Notes: Designed by renowned architect Minoru Yamasaki (World Trade Center fame), the fountains recent underwent renovation.

properties.Name: Cadieux Cafe
properties.Notes: Belgian bar and the only place in the United States where you can play featherbowling

properties.Name: Redford Theatre
properties.Notes: Historic movie theater with a Japenese interior theme and working pipe organ. Check website for film schedule especially silent picture features.

properties.Name: Buddy's Pizza
properties.Notes: Yes Detroit has it's own style of pizza and Buddy's is one of the best places to get it.

properties.Name: The Fowling Warehouse
properties.Notes: It's football and bowling. Yes it's fowling.

properties.Name: Eastern Market
properties.Notes: 24 acre market district. Especially good on market day (Saturday)

properties.Name: Campus Martius
properties.Notes: Beautiful downtown park with lots of programming throughout the year.

properties.Name: Belle Isle
properties.Address1: East Jefferson and East Grand Blvd
properties.Notes: Detroit's beautiful island park.

properties.Name: Mexicantown
properties.Notes: Hispanic neighborhood near the bridge to Canada with many Mexican restaurants.

properties.Name: Historic Fort Wayne
properties.Notes: Star-shaped fort built in the 1840s. Check out the historic barracks. Open Saturdays and Sundays seasonally.

properties.Name: Heidelberg Project
properties.Notes: Neighborhood sized art project. Trash or art, you decide.

properties.Name: Greektown
properties.Notes: Lots of and lots greek restaurants and a big ole casino.

properties.Name: GAR Building
properties.Notes: Grand Army of the Republic Building. It's a castle and former clubhouse for veterans of the Civil War. Houses the trendy gastropub Republic.

properties.Name: Motown Museum
properties.Notes: Hitsville USA, Motown museum is the site of the original Motown records recording studio.

properties.Name: Dequindre Cut Greenway
properties.Notes: Non-motorized pedestrian trail connecting Eastern Market with the Riverfront

properties.Name: Fisher Building
properties.Notes: Art deco skyscraper from the 1920s. Interior is beautiful and awashed in marble.

properties.Name: Keyworth Stadium
properties.Notes: Check out Detroit City FC in this Works Progress Administation era 7,000 person stadium.

properties.Name: Two James Spirits
properties.Notes: Craft distrillery with a rustic, hip-looking tasting room.

properties.Name: Chene Park and Riverwalk
properties.Notes: Larger outdoor amphitheater on the Detroit River. Part of growing revitalization and greening of the city's waterfront.

properties.Name: Packard Automotive Plant
properties.Address1: East Grand Blvd and Concord Ave
properties.Notes: Enormous former auto plant. It until recently has been the poster child of the Detroit's industrial decline. Multi-phase rehabilitation is set to begin in May 2017.

properties.Name: Dutch Girl Donuts
properties.Notes: Opened since 1947. Simple good donuts.

properties.Name: Avalon International Breads
properties.Notes: Cafe and bakery serving fresh breads, baked goods, and sandwiches. A Detroit institution. Recently opened another cafe downtown.

properties.Name: Corktown Neighborhood
properties.Notes: Historic Irish neighborhood. Detroit's oldest neighborhood and noted for unique shotgun style homes.

properties.Name: Woodlawn Cemetery
properties.Notes: Historic Detroit cemetery. Notable people buried here include the Dodge Brothers, several Fords, and Rosa Parks.

properties.Name: Scott Memorial Fountain
properties.Address1: East Jefferson and East Grand Blvd
properties.Notes: Named after the man who donated the money to construct it (also a reported scoundrel of Detroit's past) this enormous fountain is a must see on Belle Isle.
